column1: The Nextera DNA sample Preparation kit including sequencing adapters and sample specific barcodes was used to prepare a DNA library and sequenced at MR DNA on an Illumina MiSeq instrument.
Before processing them, we used PEAR64 to merge all the Illumina pair - end reads retrieved.
Two types of sequencing strategies, paired - end ( PE) and single - end ( SE), were followed using the BGISEQ - 500 platform with read length of 50 bp and 100 bp, respectively ( insert size 250bp).
As expected, a large proportion of BGISEQ - 500 generated sequences; 95. 93% 98. 80% and 96. 47% 98. 61% for SE100 and PE50 reads, respectively, remained as high - quality reads.
All high - throughput sequencing data were deposited in the short Read Archive ( SRA) of the European Nucleotide Archive ( ENA) under study accession number PRJEB17854.
The MALASPINA datasets are from the 0. 2 to 0. 8m fraction and were sequenced using HiSeq2000 ( paired end reads of length 150bp).
The 16S rRNA libraries for sequencing were prepared according to the 16S rRNA metagenomics protocol for MiSeq System ( Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA) [ 35], with minor modifications.
The V4 region of the 16S rRNA gene from each sample was amplified and sequenced using the Illumina Sequencing platform within the Vanderbilt Technologies for Advanced Genomics Laboratory.
TransITS amplicons were fragmented using the Nextera kit ( Illumina, San Diego, CA), and both libraries were barcoded and sequenced with MiSeq V3 ( 300bp 2) ( Illumina, San Diego, CA).

Illumina MiSeq V3 - V4 16S rRNA metagenomics library preparation and sequencing The hypervariable V3 - V4 16S rRNA region of the bacterial gene was targeted by universal bacterial primer 319F ( 5 - CCTACGGGNGGCWGCAG - 3) and 806R ( 5 - GACTACHVGGGTATCTAATCC - 3) as previously described [ 34].
For third - generation sequencing, purified fecal DNA was amplified using bacterial 16S rRNA full - length primers and sequenced using Pacbio RSII system ( Pacific Biosciences, USA).
Sequencing Total RNA from each sample was converted to Illumina sequencing libraries using Illuminas TruSeq RNA Sample Prep Kit v2 according to manufacturers instructions.
Sequencing was conducted with an Illumina MiSeq system ( Illumina) with the 500 cycle V2chemistry at Auckland University of Technology, New Zealand.
Paired - end sequencing with a 100 cycle Illumina HiSeq run generated partial ~ 30 bp overlaps, and six libraries were multiplexed per lane.
For shotgun pyrosequenced data, sequences were first analysed with the MOTHUR software package 1. 27 to remove sequences shorter than 100 bp.
Sequencing of 16S rRNA genes by Illumina MiSeq was performed to check the purity of the culture.
Adaptor - appended fragments were sequenced on Illumina MiSeq desktop sequencer ( 2300bp paired - end run, San Diego, CA) according to standard protocols.

16S rDNA sequencing of selected samples DNA samples ( from two independent replicates) collected on days 30, 37 and 50 ( phase 2), and days 178, 192 and 206 ( phase 4) from the fermenter and post - digester were selected for high throughput sequencing of the amplified 16S rDNA fragments as described by Sundberg et al. ( 2013).

The samples ( 27 pooled and 4 individual replicates) were next individually barcoded and sequenced using the Illumina MiSeq platform via the MiSeq Reagent Kit v2 ( 500 cycle), producing paired - end reads each 250 nucleotides in length.
using an Illumina HiSeq2000 ( San Diego, CA, USA).
16S rDNA extraction Microbial community taxonomic composition was assessed via Illumina sequencing of 16S rRNA gene fragments amplified from bacterioplankton DNA from stations 2 and 6.
